page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY - COLEBY
page.content: {ORIGINS:}Evidence of neolithic barrow. Romans built Ermine Street on pre-his- toric ridgeway - now "High Dyke" Green Lane. {SIWARD}brought Danish name Col(hill) + By(settlement). {RELIGION:}Anglo-Saxon cemetery found in 1833. Remains of fine Norman church developed during wool trade prosperity to 1500. Rector Thomas de Cantilupe made Chancellor(1265),later canonised. {HALL:}Pre-conquest carved stone found when rebuilding. 1086 King's Manor in Boothby Wapentake. Lister family supported Cromwell - Thomas member of Council of State which tried Charles I - arrested 1660 and exiled. {VILLAGERS:}Anglo-Saxon agricultural settlement - 3 field system. In 1086 predominance of Sokemen who tilled. C11 mill. 1758 enclosures & industry brought machinery burning, charities, Sunday School,chapel.C20 village hall.
